SENT.plain: OBJECTIVE: The pathogenesis of otitic hydrocephalus remains unclear
The use of radiological examination is very important to clarify both the diagnosis and the pathogenesis
In this article the role of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and magnetic resonance venography (MRV) is discussed
PATIENTS: Two patients with the diagnosis of otitic hydrocephalus and their MRI and MRV findings are presented
RESULTS: Both of the patients presented had thrombus in their transverse sinuses pre-operatively demonstrated by MRI causing decreased flow on MRV
After the treatment blood flow through the sinus increased significantly as the symptoms subsided
CONCLUSION: MRI and MRV are valuable tools for diagnosis and follow-up of otitic hydrocephalus
